action.action-desc: Mr. Ben Ray Luján of New Mexico (for himself and Mr. Johnson of Ohio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to authorize certain recovery services grants to be used to establish regional technical assistance centers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Peer Support Communities of Recovery Act.
Section 547 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290ee–2) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking Definition and inserting Definitions;
in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking In this section, the term recovery community organization means an independent nonprofit organization that— and inserting In this section:;
by redesignating paragraphs (1) and (2) as subparagraphs (A) and (B), respectively, and moving such subparagraphs (as so redesignated) 2 ems to the right;
by inserting before subparagraph (A) (as so redesignated) the following:

paragraph.text: The term recovery community organization means an independent nonprofit organization that—

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
a national nonprofit entity focused on substance use disorder with a network of local affiliates and partners that are geographically and organizationally diverse; or

clause.text: established by individuals in personal and family recovery; and
serving prevention, treatment, recovery, payor, faith-based, and criminal justice stakeholders in the implementation of local addiction and recovery initiatives.

subparagraph.text: by striking The Secretary shall award grants to recovery community organizations and inserting

paragraph.text: shall award grants to recovery community organizations

subparagraph.text: by striking services. and inserting services and, at the option of each such organization, carry out the activities described in subparagraphs (A) through (C) of subsection (c)(2); and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: may award grants to eligible entities for purposes of establishing regional technical assistance centers, in accordance with subsection (c)(2)(D).
by redesignating subsections (d) and (e) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking shall be used and inserting to a recovery community organization shall be used; and

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking may be used to— and inserting may be used to carry out the activities described in subparagraphs (A) through (C) in the case of a grant awarded to a recovery community organization and to carry out subparagraph (D) in the case of a grant awarded to an eligible entity.;

subclause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking build and inserting Build; and
in clause (vii), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period;
by striking reduce and inserting Reduce; and
by striking ; and and inserting a period;

clause.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking conduct and inserting Conduct; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: Provide for the establishment of regional technical assistance centers to provide regional technical assistance for the following:

clause.text: Implementation of regionally driven, peer-delivered addiction recovery support services before, during, after, or in lieu of addiction treatment.
Overdose reversal medication training and dissemination.

paragraph.text: in subsection (d) (as so redesignated), by inserting before the period the following: , and $15,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.
